title: Norm (abelian group)
summary: In mathematics, specifically abstract algebra, if ( G , + ) {\displaystyle (G,+)} is an (abelian) group with identity element e {\displaystyle e} then ν : G → R {\displaystyle \nu \colon G\to \mathbb {R} } is said to be a norm on ( G , + ) {\displaystyle (G,+)} if:
